context: The word 'nenä' in Finnish means 'nose'. It refers to the protuberance on the human or animal face used for smelling and breathing. The word declines based on case, as shown in the dictionary definition, affecting its form depending on its grammatical role in a sentence. For example, 'nenän' is the genitive singular form meaning 'of the nose', while 'nenät' is the nominative plural form meaning 'noses'. It can also refer to the tip of an object or peninsula (niemen nenä).
